newsitem.title: USA: Director holds 7.1 pct U.S. Can stake.
newsitem.headline: Director holds 7.1 pct U.S. Can stake.

text.p: Ricardo Poma, a director of U.S. Can Corp, said Monday he holds a 7.1 percent stake in the Oak Brook, Ill.,-based company.

In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, Poma, who is a native of El Salvador, said he holds 918,000 common shares of U.S. Can, including 426,000 shares through Salcorp Ltd and 60,000 shares through Katsura S.A..
In addition he also holds 432,000 shares as trustee of United Capital Trust, a family trust, Poma said. Poma owns Salcorp and Katsura, according to the filing.
Poma said his latest transactions include the purchase through Katsura of 23,200 shares of U.S. Can on October 22 at prices ranging from $16.25 to $16.50 a share.
Poma is managing partner of Poma Hermanos de C.V., a family holding company involved in automobile distribution, hotels, real estate development and manafacturing, according to the filing.
